metadata.title: FedRAMP High Baseline Controls
metadata.source: FedRAMP Rev 5 High Baseline (2023), NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5
metadata.description: FedRAMP High baseline control requirements for DoD IL5+ cloud systems. Extends FedRAMP Moderate with additional controls and enhanced parameters for high-impact systems processing classified or mission-critical data.

controls.title: Access Control Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate an access control policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance. Review and update the current access control policy and procedures in accordance with FedRAMP-defined frequencies.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Policy must explicitly address cloud-specific access control requirements including API access, multi-tenancy isolation, CSP administrative access, and high-impact data handling procedures.

controls.title: Account Management
controls.description: Define and document account types, establish conditions for group and role membership, specify authorized users and access authorizations, require approvals for account creation, create/enable/modify/disable/remove accounts in accordance with policy, monitor accounts, and review accounts for compliance.

fedramp_parameters.notification_period: notify account managers within 24 hours when accounts are no longer required, users are terminated or transferred, or system usage changes

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: CSP must implement automated mechanisms to support account management functions. Shared/group accounts are prohibited for privileged access. Guest/anonymous accounts must be disabled. For High systems, account reviews must include verification of need-to-know and clearance status.

controls.title: Account Management | Automated System Account Management
controls.description: Employ automated mechanisms to support the management of system accounts including creation, modification, enabling, disabling, and removal of accounts.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Automated account management must integrate with CSP identity provider and support SCIM or equivalent provisioning protocols.

controls.title: Account Management | Automated Temporary and Emergency Account Management
controls.description: Automatically remove or disable temporary and emergency accounts after a FedRAMP-defined time period.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Emergency accounts must be logged and reviewed. Notification to ISSO required upon emergency account activation.

controls.title: Account Management | Disable Accounts
controls.description: Disable accounts when the accounts have been inactive for a FedRAMP-defined time period.

fedramp_parameters.inactivity_period: 90 days for user accounts, 35 days for non-interactive service accounts

controls.title: Account Management | Automated Audit Actions
controls.description: Automatically audit account creation, modification, enabling, disabling, and removal actions and notify appropriate personnel.

controls.title: Account Management | Inactivity Logout
controls.description: Require that users log out when the FedRAMP-defined time period of expected inactivity is exceeded or when the session inactivity timeout is reached.

fedramp_parameters.inactivity_logout: after session inactivity timeout defined in AC-12

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Users must be notified prior to automatic logout. Re-authentication required after logout.

controls.title: Account Management | Account Monitoring for Atypical Usage
controls.description: Monitor system accounts for atypical usage and report atypical usage of system accounts to designated personnel.

fedramp_parameters.monitoring_criteria: atypical usage patterns including off-hours access, excessive failed login attempts, access from unusual locations, and privilege escalation attempts

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Monitoring must include behavioral analytics for high-impact systems. Automated alerting required for anomalous privileged account activity.

controls.title: Account Management | Disable Accounts for High-Risk Individuals
controls.description: Disable accounts of individuals within 24 hours of discovery of significant risk.

fedramp_parameters.disable_timeframe: within 1 hour of determination of significant risk for High baseline

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Risk determinations must be documented in audit trail. Accounts must be disabled, not deleted, to preserve forensic data.

controls.title: Access Enforcement
controls.description: Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Access enforcement must address multi-tenant isolation ensuring one tenant cannot access another tenant's data or resources. API-level access enforcement is required.

controls.title: Information Flow Enforcement
controls.description: Enforce approved authorizations for controlling the flow of information within the system and between connected systems based on FedRAMP-defined information flow control policies.

fedramp_parameters.flow_control_policies: policies defined by the organization and approved by the JAB/AO

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Information flow enforcement must prevent data exfiltration between authorization boundaries and enforce tenant data isolation in multi-tenant architectures.

controls.title: Information Flow Enforcement | Flow Control of Encrypted Information
controls.description: Prevent encrypted information from bypassing content-checking mechanisms by decrypting the information, blocking the flow of the encrypted information, or terminating communications sessions attempting to pass encrypted information.

fedramp_parameters.encrypted_flow_action: decrypt and inspect or block encrypted traffic that cannot be inspected

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: TLS inspection required at authorization boundaries for High systems. SSL/TLS break-and-inspect must use FIPS 140-2 validated modules.

controls.title: Separation of Duties
controls.description: Identify and document duties of individuals requiring separation. Define system access authorizations to support separation of duties.

fedramp_parameters.separation_duties: at minimum: security administration, system administration, audit administration, and application administration

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: CSP must document separation of duties between CSP operations and customer tenant administration.

controls.title: Least Privilege
controls.description: Employ the principle of least privilege, allowing only authorized accesses for users and processes which are necessary to accomplish assigned organizational tasks.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Least privilege must be enforced for CSP administrative access to customer tenants. Just-in-time access provisioning is required for privileged functions on High systems.

controls.title: Least Privilege | Authorize Access to Security Functions
controls.description: Authorize access to security functions and security-relevant information for only those personnel explicitly designated by the organization.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Access to security functions must be reviewed quarterly for High systems.

controls.title: Least Privilege | Non-Privileged Access for Nonsecurity Functions
controls.description: Require that users of system accounts or roles with access to security functions or security-relevant information use non-privileged accounts or roles when accessing nonsecurity functions.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Privileged accounts must be separate from day-to-day user accounts with no email or web browsing capability.

controls.title: Least Privilege | Network Access to Privileged Commands
controls.description: Authorize network access to privileged commands only for compelling operational needs and document the rationale for such access in the security plan for the system.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Network access to privileged commands must traverse a jump box or privileged access workstation (PAW). All sessions must be recorded.

controls.title: Least Privilege | Privileged Accounts
controls.description: Restrict privileged accounts on the system to specific personnel or roles designated by the organization.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: CSP must maintain a list of all privileged accounts and review quarterly.

controls.title: Least Privilege | Log Use of Privileged Functions
controls.description: Log the execution of privileged functions.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Logs of privileged function execution must be retained for at least one year and available for review within 72 hours.

controls.title: Least Privilege | Prohibit Non-Privileged Users from Executing Privileged Functions
controls.description: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: System must enforce technical controls preventing privilege escalation, not rely solely on policy.

controls.title: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
controls.description: Enforce a limit of consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user during a FedRAMP-defined time period and automatically lock the account or delay the next logon prompt.

fedramp_parameters.lockout_duration: lock account for at least 30 minutes or until released by an administrator

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: All failed logon attempts must be logged with source IP, timestamp, and account identifier.

controls.title: System Use Notification
controls.description: Display a system use notification message or banner before granting access to the system that provides privacy and security notices consistent with applicable laws, policies, and standards.

fedramp_parameters.banner_content: US Government system notice with unauthorized use warning and monitoring consent

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Banner must be displayed for all interactive sessions including web, SSH, API console, and administrative interfaces.

controls.title: Concurrent Session Control
controls.description: Limit the number of concurrent sessions for each system account to the FedRAMP-defined number.

fedramp_parameters.max_concurrent_sessions: 3 sessions for privileged users, 5 sessions for non-privileged users

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Concurrent session limits must be enforced at both the application and infrastructure layers. Exceeding session limits must generate an alert.

controls.title: Device Lock
controls.description: Prevent further access to the system by initiating a device lock after a FedRAMP-defined time period of inactivity, and retain the device lock until the user re-authenticates.

controls.title: Device Lock | Pattern-Hiding Displays
controls.description: Conceal information previously visible on the display with a publicly viewable image via a pattern-hiding display.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Screen lock must completely obscure all displayed information. No partial screen savers permitted.

controls.title: Session Termination
controls.description: Automatically terminate a user session after FedRAMP-defined conditions or trigger events.

fedramp_parameters.session_timeout: 30 minutes of inactivity for non-privileged sessions
fedramp_parameters.privileged_session_timeout: 15 minutes of inactivity for privileged sessions

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Session tokens must be invalidated server-side upon termination. Re-authentication required after session timeout.

controls.title: Permitted Actions Without Identification or Authentication
controls.description: Identify user actions that can be performed on the system without identification or authentication consistent with organizational mission and business functions and document and justify such actions.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: CSP must document all unauthenticated access paths and ensure no CUI is accessible without authentication. For High, unauthenticated actions must be minimized to only public-facing content.

controls.title: Remote Access
controls.description: Establish and document usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for each type of remote access allowed. Authorize each type of remote access to the system prior to allowing such connections.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: All remote administrative access must use encrypted channels (FIPS-validated cryptography) and multi-factor authentication.

controls.title: Remote Access | Monitoring and Control
controls.description: Employ automated mechanisms to monitor and control remote access methods.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Real-time monitoring of all remote access sessions required for High systems.

controls.title: Remote Access | Protection of Confidentiality and Integrity Using Encryption
controls.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality and integrity of remote access sessions.

fedramp_parameters.encryption_standard: FIPS 140-2 validated cryptographic modules, TLS 1.2 minimum, TLS 1.3 preferred

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: All remote access must use FIPS 140-2 validated encryption. SSH must use FIPS-approved algorithms only.

controls.title: Remote Access | Managed Access Control Points
controls.description: Route remote accesses through authorized and managed network access control points.

fedramp_parameters.access_control_points: managed VPN concentrators or zero-trust network access gateways

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: All remote access must traverse a managed access control point with full packet inspection capability. Split tunneling is prohibited.

controls.title: Remote Access | Privileged Commands and Access
controls.description: Authorize the execution of privileged commands and access to security-relevant information via remote access only for compelling operational needs and document the rationale for such access in the security plan.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Remote privileged access must use dedicated privileged access workstations. Session recording required for all remote privileged commands.

controls.title: Wireless Access
controls.description: Establish configuration requirements, connection requirements, and implementation guidance for each type of wireless access. Authorize each type of wireless access to the system prior to allowing such connections.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Wireless access must use WPA3 or FIPS-validated encryption. Wireless IDS/IPS required.

controls.title: Wireless Access | Authentication and Encryption
controls.description: Protect wireless access to the system using authentication of users and/or devices and encryption.

controls.title: Wireless Access | Restrict Configurations by Users
controls.description: Identify and explicitly authorize users allowed to independently configure wireless networking capabilities.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Users must not be permitted to configure ad-hoc wireless networks. Configuration changes require ISSO approval.

controls.title: Wireless Access | Antennas and Transmission Power Levels
controls.description: Select radio antennas and calibrate transmission power levels to reduce the probability that signals from wireless access points can be received outside of organization-controlled boundaries.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Wireless signal leakage assessments required annually. Transmission power must be minimized to prevent emanation beyond facility boundaries.

controls.title: Access Control for Mobile Devices
controls.description: Establish configuration requirements, connection requirements, and implementation guidance for organization-controlled mobile devices, including when such devices are outside of controlled areas. Authorize the connection of mobile devices to organizational systems.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Mobile devices accessing High systems must be organization-managed with MDM enrollment, full-device encryption, and remote wipe capability.

controls.title: Access Control for Mobile Devices | Full Device or Container-Based Encryption
controls.description: Employ full-device encryption or container-based encryption to protect the confidentiality and integrity of information on mobile devices.

controls.title: Use of External Systems
controls.description: Establish terms and conditions consistent with trust relationships established with other organizations owning, operating, and/or maintaining external systems, allowing authorized individuals to access the system from external systems and process, store, or transmit organization-controlled information using external systems.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: External systems must meet equivalent FedRAMP High baseline requirements or connections must be restricted via controlled interfaces with data loss prevention.

controls.title: Use of External Systems | Limits on Authorized Use
controls.description: Permit authorized individuals to use an external system to access the system or to process, store, or transmit organization-controlled information only after verification that required security controls are implemented on the external system as specified in organizational policy.

controls.title: Use of External Systems | Portable Storage Devices â€” Restricted Use
controls.description: Restrict the use of organization-controlled portable storage devices by authorized individuals on external systems.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Portable storage devices must be encrypted with FIPS 140-2 validated encryption. Use of personally-owned portable storage is prohibited on High systems.

controls.title: Information Sharing
controls.description: Facilitate information sharing by enabling authorized users to determine whether access authorizations assigned to a sharing partner match the information's access and use restrictions and employ automated mechanisms or manual processes to assist users in making information sharing and collaboration decisions.

fedramp_parameters.sharing_circumstances: when processing, storing, or transmitting CUI between systems at different impact levels or with different authorization boundaries

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Information sharing agreements must be documented and approved by the AO. Automated data classification and labeling required for High systems.

controls.title: Publicly Accessible Content
controls.description: Designate individuals authorized to make information publicly accessible, train authorized individuals to ensure publicly accessible information does not contain nonpublic information, review proposed content before posting, review content on the publicly accessible system for nonpublic information and remove if found.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Automated scanning for CUI/PII in publicly accessible content required. Immediate removal upon discovery of nonpublic information.

controls.title: Awareness and Training Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate a security and privacy awareness and training policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance. Review and update the policy and procedures.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Policy must address cloud-specific security awareness topics including phishing, social engineering, and insider threat for High systems.

controls.title: Literacy Training and Awareness
controls.description: Provide security and privacy literacy training to system users as part of initial training for new users and at least annually thereafter. Update literacy training and awareness content at least annually and following significant security events.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Training must include cloud security best practices, CUI handling, and incident reporting procedures.

controls.title: Literacy Training and Awareness | Insider Threat
controls.description: Provide literacy training on recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Insider threat training must be provided within 30 days of onboarding and annually thereafter.

controls.title: Role-Based Training
controls.description: Provide role-based security and privacy training to personnel with assigned security roles and responsibilities before authorizing access and at least annually thereafter.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Role-based training must include system-specific security procedures, incident handling, and CUI protection requirements.

controls.title: Training Records
controls.description: Document and monitor individual security and privacy training activities including initial training, refresher training, and role-based training. Retain individual training records for at least the FedRAMP-defined time period.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Training records must be available for audit within 72 hours of request.

controls.title: Audit and Accountability Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate an audit and accountability policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance. Review and update the policy and procedures.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Audit policy must address cloud-specific considerations including API logging, multi-tenant audit isolation, and CSP administrative action logging.

controls.title: Event Logging
controls.description: Identify the types of events that the system is capable of logging in support of the audit function. Coordinate the event logging function with other organizational entities requiring audit-related information.

fedramp_parameters.auditable_events: successful and unsuccessful account logon events, account management events, object access, policy change, privilege functions, process tracking, system events, and all administrator activity

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Event logging must include API calls, configuration changes, data access events, and container/orchestration events. Audit review frequency: at least weekly.

controls.title: Content of Audit Records
controls.description: Ensure that audit records contain information that establishes the type of event, when the event occurred, where the event occurred, the source of the event, the outcome of the event, and the identity of individuals or subjects associated with the event.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Audit records must include session ID, source IP, user agent, and request identifiers for correlation.

controls.title: Content of Audit Records | Additional Audit Information
controls.description: Generate audit records containing additional information including full text recording of privileged commands or the individual identities of group account users.

fedramp_parameters.additional_info: full-text recording of privileged commands, session recording for administrative access, and database query logging

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Full command-line auditing required for all privileged sessions. Database transaction logging must capture query text and affected records.

controls.title: Content of Audit Records | Centralized Management of Planned Audit Record Content
controls.description: Centrally manage the content of audit records generated by the system components defined by the organization.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Centralized audit management must be implemented using a SIEM or equivalent tool. Audit record schemas must be standardized across all system components.

controls.title: Audit Log Storage Capacity
controls.description: Allocate audit log storage capacity to accommodate the organization-defined audit log retention requirements and reduce the likelihood of such capacity being exceeded.

fedramp_parameters.storage_capacity: sufficient to retain at least 90 days online and 1 year total

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Audit log storage must support automated archival and retrieval. Storage growth monitoring and alerting required.

controls.title: Audit Log Storage Capacity | Transfer to Alternate Storage
controls.description: Transfer audit logs to a different system, media type, or location when the log storage capacity of the primary audit log storage reaches the organization-defined percentage.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Alternate storage must be in a separate availability zone or region. Transfer must be automated and verified.

controls.title: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures
controls.description: Alert designated personnel in the event of an audit logging process failure and take organization-defined additional actions.

fedramp_parameters.alert_personnel: system administrators, ISSOs, and ISSMs within 5 minutes
fedramp_parameters.additional_actions: overwrite oldest audit records if storage is full and alert on overwrite

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: For High systems, audit failure must trigger automated incident response procedures. System must halt processing if audit capability cannot be restored within 5 minutes.

controls.title: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures | Storage Capacity Warning
controls.description: Provide a warning to designated personnel when allocated audit log storage volume reaches the organization-defined percentage of capacity.

fedramp_parameters.warning_threshold: 75% of allocated audit log storage capacity

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Warnings must be delivered in real-time via automated alerting mechanisms.

controls.title: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures | Real-Time Alerts
controls.description: Provide an alert within the organization-defined real-time period to designated personnel when the organization-defined audit failure events occur.

fedramp_parameters.failure_events: audit logging software/hardware errors, failures in the audit capturing mechanisms, and audit storage capacity reached

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Real-time alerts must be sent via at least two independent communication channels (e.g., email and SMS/pager).

controls.title: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting
controls.description: Review and analyze system audit records for indications of inappropriate or unusual activity and report findings to designated personnel.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Audit analysis must employ automated mechanisms to integrate audit review, analysis, and reporting for investigating and responding to suspicious activity.

controls.title: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting | Automated Process Integration
controls.description: Integrate audit record review, analysis, and reporting processes using automated mechanisms to support organizational processes for investigation and response to suspicious activities.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: SIEM or equivalent automated analysis platform required. Must support correlation across all system components.

controls.title: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting | Correlate Audit Record Repositories
controls.description: Analyze and correlate audit records across different repositories to gain organization-wide situational awareness.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Cross-repository correlation must include network, application, database, and infrastructure audit records. Correlation rules must be reviewed quarterly.

controls.title: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting | Integrated Analysis of Audit Records
controls.description: Integrate analysis of audit records with analysis of vulnerability scanning information, performance data, and system monitoring information to further enhance the ability to identify inappropriate or unusual activity.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Integrated analysis must correlate audit data with vulnerability scan results and IDS/IPS alerts.

controls.title: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting | Correlation with Physical Monitoring
controls.description: Correlate information from audit records with information obtained from monitoring physical access to further enhance the ability to identify suspicious, inappropriate, unusual, or malevolent activity.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Physical access logs must be correlated with logical access audit records for data center access events.

controls.title: Audit Record Reduction and Report Generation
controls.description: Provide and implement an audit record reduction and report generation capability that supports on-demand audit review, analysis, and reporting requirements and after-the-fact investigations of incidents.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Audit reduction tools must support queries across all audit record fields. Report generation must produce output suitable for AO review.

controls.title: Audit Record Reduction and Report Generation | Automatic Processing
controls.description: Provide and implement the capability to process, sort, and search audit records for events of interest based on defined audit fields.

controls.title: Time Stamps
controls.description: Use internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records and record time stamps that map to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) or Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) with a defined granularity of time measurement.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: All system components must synchronize to authoritative time source (e.g., NIST, DoD NTP). Time synchronization drift must not exceed 1 second.

controls.title: Protection of Audit Information
controls.description: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Audit information must be protected using access controls that limit access to authorized audit personnel only. Integrity verification of audit logs required.

controls.title: Protection of Audit Information | Store on Separate Physical Systems or Components
controls.description: Store audit records on a repository on a physically different system or system component than the system or component being audited.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Audit storage must be on a separate system with independent access controls. Cross-account or cross-region storage recommended.

controls.title: Protection of Audit Information | Cryptographic Protection
controls.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the integrity of audit information and audit tools.

fedramp_parameters.cryptographic_mechanism: FIPS 140-2 validated hashing (SHA-256 minimum) for audit record integrity

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Cryptographic hash chains or digital signatures required to detect tampering of audit records.

controls.title: Protection of Audit Information | Access by Subset of Privileged Users
controls.description: Authorize access to management of audit logging functionality to only a subset of privileged users or roles.

fedramp_parameters.authorized_users: only designated audit administrators separate from system administrators

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Audit administration role must be separate from system administration role. Dual authorization required for audit configuration changes.

controls.title: Non-Repudiation
controls.description: Provide irrefutable evidence that an individual or process performed specific actions to protect against false claims of not having performed such actions.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Non-repudiation must be enforced for all privileged actions, data exports, and configuration changes. Digital signatures or equivalent mechanisms required.

controls.title: Audit Record Retention
controls.description: Retain audit records for a FedRAMP-defined time period to provide support for after-the-fact investigations of incidents and to meet regulatory and organizational information retention requirements.

fedramp_parameters.retention_period: at least 1 year online, 3 years total for High baseline

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Audit records must be retrievable within 24 hours for the most recent 90 days, within 72 hours for records up to 1 year, and within 30 days for archived records.

controls.title: Audit Record Generation
controls.description: Provide audit record generation capability for the events defined in AU-2 at all system components where audit capability is deployed. Allow authorized personnel to select the events to be logged by specific components.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Audit record generation must be enabled by default and cannot be disabled by non-audit personnel.

controls.title: Audit Record Generation | System-Wide and Time-Correlated Audit Trail
controls.description: Compile audit records from all system components into a system-wide (logical or physical) audit trail that is time-correlated to within the organization-defined level of tolerance.

fedramp_parameters.time_tolerance: within 1 second tolerance across all system components

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: System-wide audit trail must be centralized in SIEM and support real-time correlation.

controls.title: Audit Record Generation | Changes by Authorized Individuals
controls.description: Provide and implement the capability for authorized individuals or roles to change the logging to be performed on specified system components based on defined auditable events, time thresholds, or in response to specific events.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Changes to audit logging configuration must be logged and require approval from the ISSO. Emergency changes permitted with retrospective review within 24 hours.

controls.title: Assessment, Authorization, and Monitoring Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate a security assessment and authorization policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Policy must address FedRAMP continuous monitoring requirements and JAB/AO reporting obligations.

controls.title: Control Assessments
controls.description: Develop a control assessment plan and assess the controls in the system and its environment of operation at the FedRAMP-defined frequency to determine the extent to which the controls are implemented correctly, operating as intended, and producing the desired outcome.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Assessment must be performed by an independent 3PAO. Results must be submitted to FedRAMP PMO.

controls.title: Control Assessments | Independent Assessors
controls.description: Employ independent assessors or assessment teams to conduct control assessments.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Assessors must be FedRAMP-recognized 3PAOs with appropriate clearances for High systems.

controls.title: Information Exchange
controls.description: Approve and manage the exchange of information between the system and other systems using interconnection security agreements, information exchange security agreements, memoranda of understanding or agreement, or other exchange agreements.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: All system interconnections must be documented in ISAs and approved by AO. Interconnections to non-FedRAMP systems require risk acceptance.

controls.title: Information Exchange | Restrictions on External System Connections
controls.description: Employ an allow-all, deny-by-exception or deny-all, permit-by-exception policy for allowing external systems to connect to the system.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: External connections require documented approval, risk assessment, and ISA. Default deny policy required for High systems.

controls.title: Plan of Action and Milestones
controls.description: Develop a plan of action and milestones (POA&M) for the system to document planned remediation actions to correct weaknesses or deficiencies and reduce or eliminate known vulnerabilities.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: POA&M must be submitted to FedRAMP PMO monthly. Critical/high findings must include remediation timelines.

controls.title: Authorization
controls.description: Assign a senior official as the authorizing official for the system. Ensure the authorizing official authorizes the system for processing before commencing operations.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Authorization must be granted by JAB or agency AO. Provisional ATOs from JAB are valid for 3 years with continuous monitoring.

controls.title: Continuous Monitoring
controls.description: Develop a system-level continuous monitoring strategy and implement continuous monitoring in accordance with the organization-level continuous monitoring strategy.

fedramp_parameters.monitoring_frequency: ongoing with monthly reporting to FedRAMP

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Continuous monitoring must include monthly vulnerability scanning, annual 3PAO assessment, and monthly POA&M updates per FedRAMP ConMon guidance.

controls.title: Continuous Monitoring | Independent Assessment
controls.description: Employ independent assessors or assessment teams to monitor the controls in the system on an ongoing basis.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Annual assessment by FedRAMP-recognized 3PAO required.

controls.title: Penetration Testing
controls.description: Conduct penetration testing at the FedRAMP-defined frequency on the system or system components.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Penetration testing must be performed by 3PAO or independent team. Must include social engineering, network, application, and physical testing for High systems.

controls.title: Penetration Testing | Independent Penetration Testing Agent or Team
controls.description: Employ an independent penetration testing agent or team to perform penetration testing on the system or system components.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Penetration testers must hold appropriate clearances and be independent from system development and operations teams.

controls.title: Internal System Connections
controls.description: Authorize internal connections of system components and monitor/control the connections on an ongoing basis.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Internal system connections must be documented and authorized. Micro-segmentation recommended for High systems.

controls.title: Configuration Management Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate a configuration management policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Policy must address infrastructure-as-code, container image management, and cloud service configuration baselines.

controls.title: Baseline Configuration
controls.description: Develop, document, and maintain a current baseline configuration of the system under configuration control.

fedramp_parameters.baseline_review_frequency: at least annually and when significant changes occur

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Baseline must include all cloud service configurations, network diagrams, and container/VM images. Configuration drift detection required.

controls.title: Baseline Configuration | Automation Support for Accuracy and Currency
controls.description: Employ automated mechanisms to maintain an up-to-date, complete, accurate, and readily available baseline configuration of the system.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Infrastructure-as-code and configuration management tools must be used to maintain baselines.

controls.title: Baseline Configuration | Retention of Previous Configurations
controls.description: Retain previous versions of baseline configurations of the system to support rollback.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Previous baselines must be stored in version control with rollback capability tested quarterly.

controls.title: Configuration Change Control
controls.description: Determine and document the types of changes to the system that are configuration-controlled. Review proposed configuration-controlled changes and approve or disapprove with explicit consideration for security and privacy impact analyses.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: All changes must go through formal change control board review. Emergency changes require retrospective CCB approval within 48 hours.

controls.title: Configuration Change Control | Automated Documentation, Notification, and Prohibition of Changes
controls.description: Use automated mechanisms to document proposed changes, notify approval authorities, highlight unapproved changes, prohibit changes until approvals are received, and document completed changes.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: CI/CD pipeline must enforce change approval gates. Unapproved changes must be automatically blocked.

controls.title: Configuration Change Control | Testing, Validation, and Documentation of Changes
controls.description: Test, validate, and document changes to the system before finalizing the implementation of the changes.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: All changes must be tested in a staging environment before production deployment. Security regression testing required.

controls.title: Configuration Change Control | Security and Privacy Representatives
controls.description: Require a security and privacy representative to be a member of the configuration change control element.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: ISSO or designated security representative must approve all configuration changes for High systems.

controls.title: Impact Analyses
controls.description: Analyze changes to the system to determine potential security and privacy impacts prior to change implementation.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Impact analysis must document security implications including effects on authorization boundary, data flows, and compliance posture.

controls.title: Access Restrictions for Change
controls.description: Define, document, approve, and enforce physical and logical access restrictions associated with changes to the system.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Only authorized personnel with documented change authorization may implement changes. Separation of duties between change requestor, approver, and implementer required.

controls.title: Access Restrictions for Change | Automated Access Enforcement and Audit Records
controls.description: Enforce access restrictions using automated mechanisms and generate audit records of the enforcement actions.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: CI/CD pipeline must enforce RBAC for deployment actions. All deployment actions must be logged with actor identity.

controls.title: Configuration Settings
controls.description: Establish and document configuration settings for system components using organization-defined security configuration checklists. Implement the configuration settings and identify, document, and approve any deviations.

fedramp_parameters.configuration_checklists: DISA STIGs, CIS Benchmarks, or vendor security guides as applicable

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Configuration settings must comply with DISA STIGs. Deviations require documented risk acceptance from AO.

controls.title: Configuration Settings | Automated Management, Application, and Verification
controls.description: Manage, apply, and verify configuration settings for system components using automated mechanisms.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Automated configuration management and compliance scanning required. Drift detection must alert within 15 minutes.

controls.title: Configuration Settings | Respond to Unauthorized Changes
controls.description: Take organization-defined actions in response to unauthorized changes to system configuration settings.

fedramp_parameters.response_actions: alert ISSO, revert unauthorized change, and generate incident ticket

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Automated remediation of unauthorized configuration changes required for High systems. Changes must be reverted within 1 hour.

controls.title: Least Functionality
controls.description: Configure the system to provide only mission-essential capabilities. Prohibit or restrict the use of specified functions, ports, protocols, software, and/or services.

fedramp_parameters.prohibited_functions: unnecessary services, protocols (Telnet, FTP, SNMP v1/v2), and software not required for system operation

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Only ports, protocols, and services documented in the SSP are permitted. All others must be disabled.

controls.title: Least Functionality | Periodic Review
controls.description: Review the system at the FedRAMP-defined frequency to identify unnecessary and/or nonsecure functions, ports, protocols, software, and services.

controls.title: Least Functionality | Prevent Program Execution
controls.description: Prevent program execution in accordance with the organization-defined policies regarding software program usage and restrictions.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Application whitelisting required for all server components. Only authorized executables may run on High systems.

controls.title: Least Functionality | Authorized Software — Allow-by-Exception
controls.description: Identify and maintain a list of authorized software programs. Employ a deny-all, permit-by-exception policy to allow the execution of authorized software programs.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Software inventory must be maintained and verified against authorized list. Unauthorized software must be blocked or removed within 24 hours.

controls.title: System Component Inventory
controls.description: Develop and document an inventory of system components that accurately reflects the system, includes all components within the authorization boundary, and is at the level of granularity deemed necessary for tracking and reporting.

fedramp_parameters.update_frequency: continuously with automated discovery and at least monthly manual verification

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Inventory must include all VMs, containers, cloud resources, APIs, and network components within the authorization boundary.

controls.title: System Component Inventory | Updates During Installation and Removal
controls.description: Update the inventory of system components as part of component installations, removals, and system updates.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: CI/CD pipeline must automatically update inventory on deployments.

controls.title: System Component Inventory | Automated Unauthorized Component Detection
controls.description: Detect the presence of unauthorized hardware, software, and firmware components within the system using automated mechanisms.

fedramp_parameters.detection_frequency: continuously or at least every 72 hours

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Unauthorized components must be flagged, quarantined, and reported to ISSO within 24 hours.

controls.title: System Component Inventory | Accountability Information
controls.description: Include in the system component inventory, information to achieve effective property accountability.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Inventory must track responsible individual, acquisition date, license status, and disposal tracking.

controls.title: Configuration Management Plan
controls.description: Develop, document, and implement a configuration management plan for the system that addresses roles, responsibilities, and configuration management processes and procedures.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: CM plan must address cloud service configuration, infrastructure-as-code practices, and container image management.

controls.title: Software Usage Restrictions
controls.description: Use software and associated documentation in accordance with contract agreements and copyright laws. Track the use of software protected by quantity licenses.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Software license compliance must be verified quarterly. Open source components must comply with license obligations.

controls.title: User-Installed Software
controls.description: Establish and enforce policies governing the installation of software by users.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: User-installed software prohibited on High systems without explicit ISSO approval. Application whitelisting enforced.

controls.title: Information Location
controls.description: Identify and document the location of organization-defined information and the specific system components on which the information is processed and stored.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Data residency requirements must be documented. For High/DoD systems, data must reside within CONUS in authorized GovCloud regions.

controls.title: Contingency Planning Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate a contingency planning policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Policy must address cloud-specific contingency scenarios including region failures, CSP service outages, and multi-tenant recovery.

controls.title: Contingency Plan
controls.description: Develop a contingency plan for the system that identifies essential mission and business functions and associated contingency requirements, provides recovery objectives, restoration priorities, and metrics.

fedramp_parameters.plan_update_triggers: significant changes to the system, operating environment, or after contingency plan testing

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Contingency plan must be tested at least annually and updated based on test results. Plan must include RPO and RTO targets.

controls.title: Contingency Plan | Coordinate with Related Plans
controls.description: Coordinate contingency plan development with organizational elements responsible for related plans.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Coordination must include CSP disaster recovery, customer notification, and FedRAMP PMO notification.

controls.title: Contingency Plan | Capacity Planning
controls.description: Conduct capacity planning so that necessary capacity for information processing, telecommunications, and environmental support exists during contingency operations.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Alternate processing capacity must support full production workload. Auto-scaling policies must account for failover scenarios.

controls.title: Contingency Plan | Resume Mission and Business Functions
controls.description: Plan for the resumption of mission and business functions within the organization-defined time period of contingency plan activation.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Full mission capability must be restored within 24 hours. Essential functions must resume within 4 hours.

controls.title: Contingency Plan | Continue Mission and Business Functions
controls.description: Plan for the continuance of mission and business functions with minimal or no loss of operational continuity.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Active-active or active-warm standby configurations required for High systems. Zero data loss (RPO=0) required for critical data.

controls.title: Contingency Plan | Identify Critical Assets
controls.description: Identify critical system assets supporting mission and business functions.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Critical assets inventory must be maintained and prioritized for recovery. Business impact analysis required annually.

controls.title: Contingency Training
controls.description: Provide contingency training to system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Training must include tabletop exercises and hands-on recovery procedures.

controls.title: Contingency Plan Testing
controls.description: Test the contingency plan for the system at the FedRAMP-defined frequency to determine the effectiveness of the plan and the readiness to execute the plan.

fedramp_parameters.test_types: functional testing with full recovery for High baseline

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Full failover test required annually for High systems. Results must be documented and deficiencies tracked in POA&M.

controls.title: Contingency Plan Testing | Coordinate with Related Plans
controls.description: Coordinate contingency plan testing with organizational elements responsible for related plans.

controls.title: Alternate Storage Site
controls.description: Establish an alternate storage site and initiate necessary agreements to permit the storage and retrieval of system backup information.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Alternate storage must be in a geographically separate region. Must meet same FedRAMP High requirements.

controls.title: Alternate Storage Site | Separation from Primary Site
controls.description: Identify an alternate storage site that is geographically separated from the primary storage site.

fedramp_parameters.separation_distance: at least 100 miles from primary site

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Alternate site must be in a different FEMA region when possible.

controls.title: Alternate Storage Site | Recovery Time and Recovery Point Objectives
controls.description: Configure the alternate storage site to facilitate recovery operations in accordance with RTO and RPO.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Automated replication required to meet RPO. Recovery testing must validate RTO/RPO targets.

controls.title: Alternate Storage Site | Accessibility
controls.description: Identify potential accessibility problems to the alternate storage site in the event of an area-wide disruption or disaster.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Alternate site must have independent network connectivity and power infrastructure.

controls.title: Alternate Processing Site
controls.description: Establish an alternate processing site and initiate necessary agreements to permit the transfer and resumption of system operations.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Alternate processing site must be pre-provisioned with capacity to handle full production workload.

controls.title: Alternate Processing Site | Separation from Primary Site
controls.description: Identify an alternate processing site that is geographically separated from the primary processing site.

fedramp_parameters.separation_distance: at least 100 miles from primary site

controls.title: Alternate Processing Site | Accessibility
controls.description: Identify potential accessibility problems to the alternate processing site in the event of an area-wide disruption.

controls.title: Alternate Processing Site | Priority of Service
controls.description: Develop alternate processing site agreements that contain priority-of-service provisions.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Service level agreements must guarantee processing priority during failover events.

controls.title: Telecommunications Services
controls.description: Establish alternate telecommunications services to permit the resumption of system operations when the primary telecommunications capabilities are unavailable.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Alternate telecommunications must use diverse routing and different service providers where possible.

controls.title: Telecommunications Services | Priority of Service Provisions
controls.description: Develop primary and alternate telecommunications service agreements that contain priority-of-service provisions.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Telecommunications priority must be established through TSP program.

controls.title: Telecommunications Services | Single Points of Failure
controls.description: Obtain alternate telecommunications services to reduce the likelihood of sharing a single point of failure with primary telecommunications services.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Network path diversity analysis required. No shared last-mile connectivity between primary and alternate.

controls.title: System Backup
controls.description: Conduct backups of user-level information, system-level information, and system documentation consistent with recovery time and recovery point objectives.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Backups must be encrypted with FIPS 140-2 validated modules. Three copies in two media types with one offsite.

controls.title: System Backup | Testing for Reliability and Integrity
controls.description: Test backup information to verify media reliability and information integrity.

fedramp_parameters.test_frequency: at least quarterly for High baseline

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Full restoration test required quarterly. Results must be documented.

controls.title: System Backup | Test Restoration Using Sampling
controls.description: Use a sample of backup information in the restoration of selected system functions as part of contingency plan testing.

controls.title: System Backup | Separate Storage for Critical Information
controls.description: Store backup copies of the operating system and other critical system software in a separate facility.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Critical system backups must be stored in a geographically separate GovCloud region.

controls.title: System Backup | Transfer to Alternate Storage Site
controls.description: Transfer system backup information to the alternate storage site at the FedRAMP-defined frequency.

fedramp_parameters.transfer_frequency: at least daily for High baseline

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Replication to alternate site must be automated and verified. Transfer must be encrypted in transit.

controls.title: System Recovery and Reconstitution
controls.description: Provide for the recovery and reconstitution of the system to a known state after a disruption, compromise, or failure.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Recovery procedures must be automated where possible. System must be reconstituted to a known secure state.

controls.title: System Recovery and Reconstitution | Transaction Recovery
controls.description: Implement transaction recovery for systems that are transaction-based.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Database transaction logging and point-in-time recovery required. Transaction replay capability must be tested.

controls.title: System Recovery and Reconstitution | Restore Within Time Period
controls.description: Provide the capability to restore system components within the FedRAMP-defined restoration time periods.

fedramp_parameters.restoration_period: within 24 hours for full system, 4 hours for critical components

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Infrastructure-as-code must support automated reprovisioning. Immutable infrastructure patterns recommended.

controls.title: Identification and Authentication Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate an identification and authentication policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Policy must address cloud-specific authentication including API key management, federation, and multi-tenant identity isolation.

controls.title: Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users)
controls.description: Uniquely identify and authenticate organizational users or processes acting on behalf of organizational users.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: All user accounts must be uniquely identifiable. No shared or generic accounts for interactive access.

controls.title: Identification and Authentication | Multi-Factor Authentication to Privileged Accounts
controls.description: Implement multi-factor authentication for access to privileged accounts.

fedramp_parameters.mfa_type: phishing-resistant MFA (FIDO2, PIV, or equivalent) required for High baseline

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: MFA must be hardware-backed or FIDO2/PIV for privileged access on High systems. SMS-based MFA prohibited.

controls.title: Identification and Authentication | Multi-Factor Authentication to Non-Privileged Accounts
controls.description: Implement multi-factor authentication for access to non-privileged accounts.

fedramp_parameters.mfa_type: phishing-resistant MFA preferred; at minimum TOTP or push notification

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: All interactive user accounts must use MFA. API access must use certificate-based or equivalent strong authentication.

controls.title: Identification and Authentication | Individual Authentication with Group Authentication
controls.description: When shared accounts or credentials are necessary, require individual authentication prior to granting access to the shared account or resource.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Individual accountability must be maintained even when shared resources are accessed. All shared account usage must be logged with individual identity.

controls.title: Identification and Authentication | Access to Accounts — Replay Resistant
controls.description: Implement replay-resistant authentication mechanisms for access to privileged and non-privileged accounts.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Authentication protocols must be replay-resistant (e.g., challenge-response, time-based tokens). Session tokens must include anti-replay protections.

controls.title: Identification and Authentication | Acceptance of PIV Credentials
controls.description: Accept and electronically verify Personal Identity Verification (PIV) credentials.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: System must accept and verify PIV/CAC credentials for DoD users. OCSP or CRL checking required for certificate validation.

controls.title: Device Identification and Authentication
controls.description: Uniquely identify and authenticate devices before establishing a local, remote, or network connection.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Device certificates or equivalent strong device authentication required. 802.1X network access control recommended.

controls.title: Device Identification and Authentication | Cryptographic Bidirectional Authentication
controls.description: Authenticate devices before establishing remote or network connections using bidirectional authentication that is cryptographically based.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Mutual TLS (mTLS) required for all inter-service communication on High systems. Device certificates must be managed via PKI.

controls.title: Identifier Management
controls.description: Manage system identifiers by receiving authorization from designated personnel to assign individual, group, role, service, or device identifiers. Select identifiers that identify individuals, groups, roles, services, or devices. Assign the identifiers to intended individuals, groups, roles, services, or devices. Prevent reuse of identifiers for a defined time period.

fedramp_parameters.reuse_prevention_period: at least 2 years for user identifiers

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Identifier lifecycle management must be automated. Orphaned identifiers must be detected and disabled within 30 days.

controls.title: Authenticator Management
controls.description: Manage system authenticators by verifying the identity of individuals, groups, roles, services, or devices receiving authenticators as part of initial authenticator distribution. Establish initial authenticator content, administrative procedures for lost or compromised authenticators, and provisions for changing or refreshing authenticators.

fedramp_parameters.password_complexity: minimum 12 characters with complexity requirements or minimum 15 characters without complexity

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Passwords must be stored using FIPS-approved one-way hashing. Default passwords must be changed before production. Authenticator compromise procedures must be documented.

controls.title: Authenticator Management | Password-Based Authentication
controls.description: For password-based authentication, enforce minimum password complexity, store and transmit only cryptographically protected passwords, enforce password minimum and maximum lifetime restrictions, prohibit password reuse, and allow temporary password use for system logons with immediate change.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Passwords must be checked against known compromised password lists. Account lockout after 3 failed attempts.

controls.title: Authenticator Management | PKI-Based Authentication
controls.description: For PKI-based authentication, validate certificates by constructing and verifying a certification path to an accepted trust anchor, enforce authorized access to the corresponding private key, and map the authenticated identity to the account of the individual or group.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: PKI certificates must be issued by DoD-approved CA or FedRAMP-approved CA. OCSP stapling or CRL checking required. Certificate pinning recommended for High systems.

controls.title: Authenticator Management | Protection of Authenticators
controls.description: Protect authenticators commensurate with the security category of the information to which use of the authenticator permits access.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Authenticators for High systems must be stored in hardware security modules (HSMs) or equivalent FIPS 140-2 Level 2+ validated modules.

controls.title: Authentication Feedback
controls.description: Obscure feedback of authentication information during the authentication process to protect the information from possible exploitation or use by unauthorized individuals.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Authentication error messages must not reveal which element (username or password) was incorrect.

controls.title: Cryptographic Module Authentication
controls.description: Implement mechanisms for authentication to a cryptographic module that meet the requirements of applicable laws, executive orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidelines for such authentication.

fedramp_parameters.fips_level: FIPS 140-2 Level 1 minimum; Level 2 for High baseline sensitive operations

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: All cryptographic modules must be FIPS 140-2 validated. CMVP validation certificate numbers must be documented in SSP.

controls.title: Identification and Authentication (Non-Organizational Users)
controls.description: Uniquely identify and authenticate non-organizational users or processes acting on behalf of non-organizational users.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Non-organizational users must be identified and authenticated with the same rigor as organizational users. Guest access prohibited on High systems.

controls.title: Identification and Authentication | Acceptance of PIV Credentials from Other Agencies
controls.description: Accept and electronically verify Personal Identity Verification (PIV) credentials from other federal agencies.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Cross-agency PIV/CAC acceptance must be supported. Federal PKI bridge trust required.

controls.title: Identification and Authentication | Acceptance of External Authenticators
controls.description: Accept only external authenticators that are NIST-compliant and meet the assurance level requirements.

fedramp_parameters.assurance_level: AAL2 minimum for High baseline, AAL3 for privileged access

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: External authenticators must meet NIST SP 800-63B assurance levels. Federation must use SAML 2.0 or OIDC with signed assertions.

controls.title: Identification and Authentication | Use of Defined Profiles
controls.description: Conform to organization-defined profiles for identity management.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Identity management must conform to FICAM profiles. SAML/OIDC implementations must follow NIST SP 800-63C federation guidelines.

controls.title: Incident Response Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate an incident response policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Policy must address FedRAMP incident reporting requirements including US-CERT notification timelines.

controls.title: Incident Response Training
controls.description: Provide incident response training to system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities.

fedramp_parameters.initial_training: within 10 days of assuming incident response role

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Training must include FedRAMP-specific incident reporting procedures and US-CERT notification requirements.

controls.title: Incident Response Training | Simulated Events
controls.description: Incorporate simulated events into incident response training to facilitate the required response by personnel in crisis situations.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Simulated incident exercises must be conducted at least annually. Scenarios must include data breach, ransomware, and insider threat.

controls.title: Incident Response Training | Automated Training Environments
controls.description: Provide an incident response training environment using automated mechanisms.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Automated training environment must simulate realistic attack scenarios and allow practice of containment and eradication procedures.

controls.title: Incident Response Testing
controls.description: Test the effectiveness of the incident response capability for the system at the FedRAMP-defined frequency using FedRAMP-defined tests.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Test results must be documented and deficiencies tracked in POA&M.

controls.title: Incident Handling
controls.description: Implement an incident handling capability for incidents that is consistent with the incident response plan and includes preparation, detection and analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Incident handling must include automated detection and correlation. FedRAMP PMO and US-CERT must be notified within 1 hour of confirmed incident for High systems.

controls.title: Incident Handling | Automated Incident Handling Processes
controls.description: Employ automated mechanisms to support the incident handling process.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: SOAR or equivalent automated incident response platform required for High systems. Automated containment actions for known attack patterns.

controls.title: Incident Handling | Information Correlation
controls.description: Correlate incident information and individual incident responses to achieve an organization-wide perspective on incident awareness and response.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Incident correlation must integrate with SIEM and threat intelligence feeds. Cross-tenant incident correlation required for CSP-level awareness.

controls.title: Incident Handling | Integrated Incident Response Team
controls.description: Establish and maintain an integrated incident response team that can be deployed to any location identified by the organization in an organization-defined time period.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Incident response team must include security, operations, legal, and communications representatives. Team must be available 24/7 for High systems.

controls.title: Incident Monitoring
controls.description: Track and document incidents on an ongoing basis.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Incident tracking system must maintain chain of custody for evidence. All incident data must be retained for at least 3 years.

controls.title: Incident Reporting
controls.description: Require personnel to report suspected incidents to the organizational incident response capability within the FedRAMP-defined time period.

fedramp_parameters.reporting_period: within 1 hour of discovery for High baseline

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: US-CERT must be notified within 1 hour of confirmed incident. FedRAMP PMO notification required per FedRAMP Incident Communications Procedures.

controls.title: Incident Reporting | Automated Reporting
controls.description: Employ automated mechanisms to assist in the reporting of incidents.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Automated incident notification to FedRAMP PMO and US-CERT required. Incident reports must include IOCs and TTPs when available.

controls.title: Incident Reporting | Supply Chain Coordination
controls.description: Provide incident information to the provider of the product or service and other organizations involved in the supply chain for systems or system components related to the incident.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Supply chain incident coordination procedures must be documented. Vendor notification required for incidents involving third-party components.

controls.title: Incident Response Assistance
controls.description: Provide an incident response support resource, integral to the organizational incident response capability, that offers advice and assistance to users of the system for the handling and reporting of incidents.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: 24/7 incident response support required for High systems. Contact information must be readily available to all system users.

controls.title: Incident Response Plan
controls.description: Develop an incident response plan that provides the organization with a roadmap for implementing its incident response capability.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Plan must address FedRAMP-specific reporting requirements, US-CERT coordination, and customer notification procedures.

controls.title: System Maintenance Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate a system maintenance policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Policy must address cloud infrastructure maintenance windows, customer notification requirements, and patch management.

controls.title: Controlled Maintenance
controls.description: Schedule, document, and review records of maintenance, repair, and replacement on system components in accordance with manufacturer or vendor specifications and/or organizational requirements.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Maintenance activities must be approved and scheduled through change management. Emergency maintenance requires retrospective documentation within 24 hours.

controls.title: Maintenance Tools
controls.description: Approve, control, and monitor the use of system maintenance tools.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Maintenance tools must be inventoried and inspected before use. Remote maintenance tools must be authorized and logged.

controls.title: Maintenance Tools | Inspect Tools
controls.description: Inspect the maintenance tools carried into a facility by maintenance personnel for improper or unauthorized modifications.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Tool inspection must be documented. Digital tools must be scanned for malware before connecting to production systems.

controls.title: Maintenance Tools | Inspect Media
controls.description: Check media containing diagnostic and test programs for malicious code before the media are used in the system.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: All removable media must be scanned in a quarantine environment before use on production systems.

controls.title: Nonlocal Maintenance
controls.description: Approve and monitor nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities. Allow the use of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic tools only as consistent with organizational policy. Employ strong authentication in the establishment of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic sessions.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: All nonlocal maintenance sessions must use MFA, encrypted channels, and session recording. Sessions must be terminated upon completion.

controls.title: Maintenance Personnel
controls.description: Establish a process for maintenance personnel authorization and maintain a list of authorized maintenance organizations or personnel. Verify that non-escorted personnel performing maintenance possess required access authorizations. Designate organizational personnel with required access authorizations and technical competence to supervise the maintenance activities of personnel who do not possess the required access authorizations.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Maintenance personnel must have appropriate background checks and clearances for High systems. Foreign nationals performing maintenance require additional oversight.

controls.title: Timely Maintenance
controls.description: Obtain maintenance support and/or spare parts for system components within the FedRAMP-defined time period of failure.

fedramp_parameters.maintenance_timeframe: within 24 hours for critical components, 72 hours for non-critical

controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Spare parts inventory or vendor SLAs must support defined maintenance timeframes. Hot-spare capability required for critical infrastructure.

controls.title: Media Protection Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate a media protection policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Policy must address cloud storage media, virtual disk images, backup media, and CUI marking requirements for media.

controls.title: Media Access
controls.description: Restrict access to digital and non-digital media to authorized individuals using organization-defined controls.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: Media containing CUI must be stored in controlled-access areas. Digital media access must be logged.

controls.title: Media Marking
controls.description: Mark system media indicating the distribution limitations, handling caveats, and applicable security markings of the information.
controls.fedramp_additional_requirements: All media containing CUI must be marked with CUI banner and handling instructions. Digital media must include metadata markings.

controls.title: Media Storage
controls.description: Physically control and securely store digital and non-digital media within controlled areas using organization-defined controls.

fedramp_parameters.controlled_areas: locked rooms, safes, or containers with access limited to authorized personnel
